verses.roman:
evaṁ sañjāta-vairāgyo
vijñānāloka ātmani
vicarāmi mahīm etāṁ
mukta-saṅgo 'nahaṅkṛtaḥ

synonyms: evam—thus; sañjāta—completely developed; vairāgyaḥ—detachment; vijñāna—realized knowledge; ālokaḥ—having vision; ātmani—in the Supreme Personality of Godhead; vicarāmi—I wander; mahīm—the earth; etām—this; mukta—freed; saṅgaḥ—from attachment; anahaṅkṛtaḥ—without false ego.
translation: Having learned from my spiritual masters, I remain situated in realization of the Supreme Personality of Godhead and, fully renounced and enlightened by realized spiritual knowledge, wander the earth without attachment or false ego.
